data.title: Bynum to go under knife
data.meta_description: Los Angeles Lakers center Andrew Bynum will have surgery on his ailing right knee after a visit to the World Cup in South Africa.
data.text:
"I'm going to wait to do it after (the trip) so I can do a proper rehab," Bynum said on Tuesday, the day after celebrating the Lakers' championship with a parade in downtown Los Angeles.

Bynum tore his lateral meniscus in the first round of the playoffs against Oklahoma City in April but continued to play.

He had his knee drained twice during the playoffs and was with the team when they clinched their 16th championship with a Game Seven victory over the Boston Celtics.

NBA

Kevin Durant out indefinitely with foot injury

21/03/2015 at 08:35

"All I was thinking was that 'I have to play,' and 'I'm going to play,'" Bynum, who had his knee drained again this week, told the team's website. "I wanted to be a part of it anyway I could."

Bynum, who said the injury was not that serious, is leaving for South Africa on Monday and will root for Brazil.

His surgery will likely be around mid-July.
